title: [K-12] Exploring Sustainability: Augmented Reality Game-Based Science Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Basic scientific knowledge and general understanding of sustainability
context.additional_context: Blended class utilizing smartphone-based augmented reality games (ARG), combining classroom theory learning with outdoor mission-based project activities

learning_goals: Learners can explain at least three causes of climate change and solutions through augmented reality games.

In teams of 3–4, learners complete in-game collaborative missions (e.g., virtual city energy-saving project) and write a sustainable lifestyle design plan (including three energy-saving strategies and two recycling system proposals). They achieve ≥70/100 points on the teacher evaluation rubric (creativity 20%, feasibility 30%, collaboration participation 50%).

Analyzing ARG data collected over one week, learners propose ≥3 environmental impact reduction strategies (e.g., energy saving, recycling promotion) individually and by group, and write a report achieving ≥14/20 points on the teacher evaluation rubric (clarity, feasibility, effectiveness).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
